body.para: With the Standard specifications, four coolant related switches are allocated to the main operation panel. These switches are valid regardless of the operation mode. When a switch is pressed, the corresponding function is turned ON (switch lamp illuminated). When the switch is pressed again, the function is turned OFF (switch lamp extinguished).
The functions not allocated to the main operation panel are turned ON/OFF on the Function screen. These switches can also be allocated to main operation panel with the Flexible Switch function.

li.text: Do not discharge coolant when a Tool is not clamped in the Spindle. Failure to observe this precaution may result in a breakdown of the machine.

table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

para.text: When this switch is turned ON, all coolant being discharged is temporarily stopped. When the switch is turned OFF, coolant discharge restarts.
This switch turns ON the Nozzle coolant and shower cleaning coolant. When the switch is turned OFF, operation is stopped.

table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

para.text: When this switch is turned ON, Through Spindle Coolant operation is started. When the switch is turned OFF, operation is stopped.

td.style: vertical-align:top; width:2%; height:30px; border-top:none; border-right:none; border-bottom:none;

para.text: Even while this switch is ON, when the next M06 (Tool change) command is sent, Through Spindle Coolant is automatically turned OFF. Through Spindle Coolant is not automatically turned back ON.
The Through Spindle Coolant is also turned ON by M26.
When this switch is turned ON, Air Blow operation is started. When the switch is turned OFF, operation is stopped.
The Air Blow is also turned ON by M07.
